summary: The document outlines procedural guidelines for meetings, including agenda distribution, minute-taking, and member review processes. It emphasizes the importance of accurate documentation and the roles of the Chairperson and Secretary in managing meeting records.
keyFacts: The Chairperson has the authority to grant exceptions to agenda distribution requirements for extraordinary meetings.
Minutes of meetings must include names of attendees, decisions taken, and major discussion points.
Members have a seven-day period to suggest changes to the minutes after they are distributed.
